page.title: 04HOUSING continued
page.content: made to make alterations and extens- -ions blend with existing housing. After World War 1 a few private houses and council houses were built but in the inter-war period there was not a great deal of building. In 1947 Sudburn Avenue was built and by 1951 there were 370 private houses in the village. Coronation gardens was built in 1953 and since then development has taken place to the west ans south east of the village. Both council and private housing has been stone built and much effort has been made to make new housing fit in with existing homes, St Gregory Close being one of the few exceptions. A walk through the village will bear out the success of this policy.
